definition[0]: a place where there is a lot of heat or radiation
example[0]: Many microwaves heat unevenly, leading to hot spots in the milk.
example[1]: Hot spots of radioactivity were found near the power station.
definition[1]: a place that is popular for entertainment or a particular activity
example[2]: They played regularly at legendary hot spots such as the UFO Club.
definition[2]: a place where there is likely to be fighting or a particular problem
example[3]: The report identified eight pollution hot spots.
definition[3]: a part of a computer image on the screen that you can click on to make other pictures, words etc appear
definition[4]: a place in a public building where there is a computer system with an access point, which allows people in the building with a wireless computer or bluetooth mobile phone to connect to a service such as the Internet
definition[5]: a place where a fire can spread from
